## The big picture: Plants evolved from green algae
<hr>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

* **Cyanobacteria and protist existed from 1.2 bya**
    + small plants, fungi and animals are new (500 mya)

<br/>

* **Plants come from algae -> ALGAE are not plants**
    + photosynthetic protists
    + *Key 'synapomorphies' algae -> plants*
    + **?WHAT DO YOU THINK THEY ARE?**

<br/>

* **Plants support all life on earth**
    + Oxygen to breath
    + food to eat
    
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:190px; LEFT:525px; WIDTH:500px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/greenplants.jpg">

## Protist -> Garbage Can -> non plant features
<hr>
<br/>

* **Dinoflagellates - unicellular aquatic**
    + some are photosynthetic
    + haploid dominate life cycle

<br/>

* **Brown Algae - large multicellular aquatic**
    + AoG life cycle
    + identical haploid and diploid life cycle
    + photosynthetic

<br/>

* **Diatoms - unicellular aquatic**
    + all are photosynthetic
    + diploid dominated life cycle
    
</div>

## Green Algae (Oedogonium)
<hr>

<div style="float: left; width: 50%;">

* **Sister group to land plants((

<br/>

* **Unicelular, multicellular**
    + filamentous, unbranched

<br/>

* **Marine and freshwater**

<br/>

* **Reproductive features:**
    + *Oogonia* = egg containing cell
    + *Antherdia* = sperm containing cell
    
</div>

<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:250px; LEFT:600px; WIDTH:400px; HEIGHT:450px" SRC="images/greenalgae">

## So what actually makes green plants unique?
<hr>
<br/>
<br/>
<br/>

**Synapomorhies**
1) Photosynthesis with unique pigments (cholrophyll a/b & cartenoids)
2) Store sugars (from photosynthesis) as starch
3) Cells walls made of cellulose (not unique to plants)
4) Pectin to fortify cell walls (unique to plants)
5) produce cells walls in unique way at end of mitosis


<IMG STYLE="position:absolute; TOP:190px; LEFT:650px; WIDTH:450px; HEIGHT:400px" SRC="images/pigments.png">

<br/>

* **More developed Oogonium and Antherdium**
